actions.text: Mr. Moakley asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Rules have until midnight on June 26 to file a report on H. Res. 425. Agreed to without objection.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-560, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5114 with 1 hour and 30 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The rule waives all points of order against provisions of the bill for failure to comply with clauses 2 and 6 of rule XXI. The bill shall be considered for amendment by title instead of by paragraph. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order. Amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution (100-560) shall be in order. Amendments shall be considered in the order and manner specified in the report, not subject to amendment except as specified, and all points of order against the amendments shall be waived.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 124.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 262 - 157 (Roll no. 200).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 5114) making appropriations for foreign operations, export financing, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1991, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 5114 (foreign operations funding).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 5114) making appropriations for foreign operations, export financing, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1991, and for other purposes.
